translation.en: MAN 1: Fire! MAN 2: Stand back!
Everyone go into the woods!
MAN: Fire!
Fall back!
You okay? Come on, Bob. Bring him over that way.
Captain, you all right? Get down!
Gatling! They got a Gatling! Goddamn it, Cole!
translation.ko: 기관총이다! 놈들이 기관총을 갖고 있어! 젠장, 콜! 이걸로 재미 본 건 2년 전에 끝났잖아

translation.en: This stopped being fun about two years ago!
translation.ko: 젠장, 콜! 이걸로 재미 본 건 2년 전에 끝났잖아

translation.en: MAN: Move that wagon!
Stand clear! Get down!
Fire!
Cole, Bob, you boys okay? Yeah.
Take more than a cannon to kill the younger brothers, sir!
translation.ko: 영거 형제들 죽이려면 대포는 어림도 없습니다!

translation.en: I think the cannon's doing a pretty good job, Cole!
Some Indian tracker you turned out to be, Tom.
translation.ko: 너 정말 대단한 인디언 추적자였네, 톰

translation.en: You paid me to find your bluecoats. There they are.
translation.ko: 네가 돈 주면서 파란 코트 입은 놈들 찾으랬잖아, 저기 있네

translation.en: Get me the James boy. You want Jesse?
No, not Jesse. I want the one that can shoot.
translation.ko: 제시 말고 총 잘 쏘는 사람 데려오라고

translation.en: Frank! Frank!
MAN: Hold your ground! Frank, up front!
Jesse, watch your back!
Cannon or Gatling? MAN: Fire!
Cannon! Cannons.
Where you been, buddy? What's goin' on?
Well, nothin' really.
Every time I put my head up to hit that Gatling,
they try and shoot it off. We got a plan?
Yeah, my plan of lying here pissin' myself seems to be workin' mighty fine! Thank you!
translation.ko: 여기 누워서 오줌이나 지릴까 해 괜찮은 생각 같아!

translation.en: Listen, I can hit those boys from here. We just need a distraction.
translation.ko: 여기서 내가 저놈들 맞힐 수 있어 주의를 끌어 줘

translation.en: A distraction?
Why the hell didn't you just say so?
He's smilin'. That's never a good thing.
Get that rider!
[WHOOPING] We're comin', Jesse!
MAN: Head out!
Take the hill! Charge!
Fall back!
Go!
Go!
Go on, git. Git!
Go on! Go on!
Distracting enough for you? They hardly even noticed you.
translation.ko: - 주의 돌리는 거 충분했지? - 놈들이 널 보지도 않던데

translation.en: So you're saying I could've done more to attract their attention.
translation.ko: - 주의 돌리는 거 충분했지? - 놈들이 널 보지도 않던데 내가 놈들 주의를 더 끌 수 있었단 말이군

translation.en: Uh-huh. Such as?
Well, you could've worn one of those big floppy women's Easter Sunday bonnets.
translation.ko: 부활절 예배 때 여자들이 쓰는 펄럭이는 모자를 쓰지 그랬어

translation.en: Yeah, that would've made an impression. Uh-huh, I figured.
See, that's your problem, Frank.
By the time you finish figurin' out stuff, well, I'm already finished doin' it.'
translation.ko: 형이 해결책을 생각해낼 때쯤 난 이미 해결한 뒤거든

translation.en: No, Jesse, see, your problem is you're always doin' stuff
before I'm finished figuring it out.
Ooh, goddamn, boy!
Wait till we get back to Missouri.
Tell all them little gals 'bout how little Jesse James
translation.ko: 아가씨들한테 다 말해 줄 거야 제시 제임스가 혼자서

translation.en: here charged the whole Union army by hisself.
Hey, Cole, he keeps that up, he's liable to outrank you soon.
translation.ko: 콜, 제시가 저렇게 잘나가면 곧 네 상관이 될 거야

translation.en: Well, but I'll still be better-looking, won't I?
translation.ko: 그래도 생긴 건 여전히 내가 낫겠지?

translation.en: MALCOLM: Let's meet on that road over to the South!
See if we can't get those Yankees Jesse here scared off.
translation.ko: 제시한테 혼쭐이 난 양키 놈들을 잡을 수 있나 보자고

translation.en: Ride with me, cousin. I could use the walk.
translation.ko: - 내 말에 타, 사촌 - 걸으면 돼

translation.en: All right. Suit yourself. We'll have some horses
translation.ko: 네가 탈 말을 길가에 준비해 놓을게

translation.en: waitin' for you at the road. Fine.
translation.ko: 네가 탈 말을 길가에 준비해 놓을게 그래

translation.en: All right, rangers. Let's ride!
Now, I would sound just stupid saying something like that.
translation.ko: 내가 저런 소리를 내면 멍청해 보일 거야

translation.en: Where you boys going? There's Yankees back there.
translation.ko: 어디로 가는 겁니까? 저쪽엔 양키들이 있어요

translation.en: Lots of 'em. The war's over, son.
General Lee surrendered yesterday at Appomattox.
Yesterday.
Well, somebody better go tell the damn Yankees.
translation.ko: 그럼 누가 가서 양키들한테도 알려 줘야지

translation.en: What do you reckon, cousin?
Home. Cole, we go home.
And we ride like hell to get there.
God help any fool who tries to come between me and my farm again.
translation.ko: 집에 가는 동안 방해꾼이 나타나면 신이 도와주시겠지

translation.en: Now, that's the best damn plan I heard all war.
translation.ko: 전쟁 내내 들었던 것 중 제일 좋은 계획이야

translation.en: Well, boys, let's ride!
Hello, Liberty, Missouri.
Let's go home, back to our farms.
Plantin' corn, harvestin' corn and eatin' corn.
translation.ko: 옥수수를 심고 옥수수를 거두고, 옥수수를 먹고

translation.en: Corn gonna shoot at me? No.
Then I love it. Let's go.
We got problems.
FRANK: Got a garrison in town.
We're in occupied territory, boys.
Hands off your hip, Cole. You ain't scared, are you, Jesse?
translation.ko: - 총에서 손 떼, 콜 - 넌 안 무서워?

translation.en: Pick your fights, cousin. You taught me that.
translation.ko: 싸움은 선택하는 거라며 네가 가르쳐 줬잖아

translation.en: Jesus, mercy.
That's Charlie Higgins.
I'm cuttin' him down. Not now, Cole.
translation.ko: - 줄을 자를게 - 지금은 안 돼, 콜

translation.en: What in the hell is wrong with you?
In case we have to kill these son of a bitches
translation.ko: 그러다 이놈들과 한판 붙어야 할 수도 있어

translation.en: I don't want 'em to see us comin'.
translation.ko: 놈들이 우리가 오는 걸 몰랐으면 해

translation.en: I want to get back to the farm and make sure
little Jim and the girls are okay.
translation.ko: 돌아가서 동생과 여자들이 무사한지 봐야겠어 우리 집에도 들러서 우리 무사한 거 엄마한테 알려 줘

translation.en: Yeah, and stop by our spread after that and tell our ma we're all right.
translation.ko: 우리 집에도 들러서 우리 무사한 거 엄마한테 알려 줘

translation.en: We'll go see Doc Mimms.
Excuse me, sir. We're here for the doctor.
Jesse. Frank!
Zerelda? Little Zee Mimms?
Well, you were little Jesse James when you left!
Yeah, but you got big.
I-I mean, Zee, you aged.
And what I mean is, in a good way you got, you got big and older.
translation.ko: 그러니까, 좋은 의미야 너, 커지고 나이 들었다고

translation.en: Frank, will you say something please? No, you're doing just fine.
translation.ko: - 형, 말 좀 해 - 싫어, 네가 잘하고 있잖아

translation.en: Frank? Jesse? Daddy!
Where's Web?
He rode right into 'em, screamin' like a banshee.
translation.ko: 웹이 귀신처럼 비명을 지르며 적진 속으로 달려들었어요

translation.en: My little Web did that?
translation.ko: 우리 꼬맹이 웹이? 말을 타고 우리 머리 위로 점프하면서

translation.en: He jumped his horse clear over our heads,
translation.ko: 말을 타고 우리 머리 위로 점프하면서

translation.en: killed a dozen Union soldiers before they knew what him 'em.
translation.ko: 눈 깜짝할 사이에 연방군 열댓 명을 죽였죠

translation.en: Took out the Gatling gun and the cannon all by himself.
Saved all our lives, doc.
But none of the Liberty boys would have come home
translation.ko: 우리 중 누구도 살아 돌아오지 못했을 거예요

translation.en: if not for Web Mimms.
God's honest truth. Web died fighting?
Web died a hero.
Still died.
Look, doc, if there's anything we can do for you
we want to help.
Start thinking about yourselves.
translation.ko: 너희 앞가림이나 잘하렴 찰리 히긴스 꼴 나지 말고

translation.en: Don't end up like Charlie Higgins.
They found out Charlie rode with Quantrill's raiders.
translation.ko: 찰리가 게릴라 대원들과 다닌 걸 저들이 알고선

translation.en: They arrested him.
They tried him by military tribunal and they hanged him this morning.
translation.ko: 군사 재판을 받게 하더니 오늘 아침 교수형에 처한 거야

translation.en: Well, I thought there was a general amnesty.
For soldiers, yes. But if you rode
in one of the partisan bands, they'll hang you for treason.
translation.ko: 게릴라 부대에 합류하면 그건 교수형 감이야 그리고 너희는 더 위험해 농장이 있어서

translation.en: And you boys are in more danger because you've got a farm.
translation.ko: 그리고 너희는 더 위험해 농장이 있어서

translation.en: See, the railroad men come through offering
to buy up land. Nobody sells.
So the army starts hanging men who own farms for treason.
translation.ko: 군인들이 농장 소유주들을 반역죄로 교수형에 처하고 있어

translation.en: During the war, all we thought about was coming home.
translation.ko: 전쟁 내내 집에 돌아올 생각만 했어요

translation.en: And I swore I'd kill anybody who'd try to get me off my farm again now.
translation.ko: 그리고 내 농장을 뺏는 놈은 누구든 죽이겠다고 맹세했죠

translation.en: If I have to go to war with the railroad to stay,
translation.ko: 제가 철도 회사와 전쟁을 해야 한다면

translation.en: that's fine by me.
FRANK: All right, wait, look. Let's think about this.
If we have a good story and we stick to it,
we should be all right.
What story are they gonna believe, Frank?
Hmm, you were in the Confederate army
translation.ko: 너희가 후드 장군의 텍사스 군대와 함께

translation.en: with General Hood's Texas army until, say, Sharpsburg,
where you were reassigned to General Stuart's cavalry
translation.ko: 샤프스버그에 있는 스튜어트 장군 기병대로 재배치받은 후

translation.en: until you surrendered in Tennessee.
That...just might work.
DOC MIMMS: Yeah, that might just work.
Now, go on and see your ma.
She'll be glad to see her sons alive.
And for her sake... stay that way.
Zee.
Thank you for everything.
Especially that story that you told my father.
translation.ko: 특히 아빠한테 오빠 얘기 해 준 거

translation.en: Now, look, Zee-- I'm goin' to go cry now.
translation.ko: - 있지, 지... - 난 이제 가서 울래

translation.en: That Zerelda turned into a hell of a woman, eh?
Oh, yeah. Big and older?
You can shut up now, Frank. You are a charmer.
I swear to God I will shoot you in your sleep.
Next time try "fat and haggard."
Boys? My boys!
translation.ko: 우리 애들이니? 우리 애들! 살아 돌아왔구나!

translation.en: My boys! My boys are alive!
Oh, God! Praise God! You're alive!
Well, not if you don't ease up a bit, Ma.
Oh! Oh, Ma.
Did you kill Yankees? A fair number, Ma.
And did you say your prayers? Every night, Ma.
Good. Oh, now, come on inside and wash your hands for dinner.
translation.ko: 잘했다, 얼른 들어가서 손 씻고 저녁 먹자

translation.en: Oh, and you look so good. Oh! You look great!
MA: Oh, come on. FRANK: Whoo!
Howdy, boys. Look at Jimmy Younger, all grown up.
translation.ko: 안녕, 얘들아 지미 영거 좀 봐, 다 컸네

translation.en: How ya doin'? All right.
translation.ko: - 잘 지냈어? - 응 밥 먹어야 한다며 네 어머니가 우리를 안 보내셔

translation.en: Your ma wouldn't let us leave until we ate somethin'.
translation.ko: 밥 먹어야 한다며 네 어머니가 우리를 안 보내셔 - 2시간 전부터 - 음식 다 안 먹었잖아

translation.en: That was about two hours ago. I don't see clean plates.
Ma, glad to see you being so nice to our Indian friend.
MA: Ah, he's a good Christian, and he killed Yankees.
And Jesus told me that made him an all right boy.
Well, she's still talkin' to Jesus.
You know, what worries me is that Jesus is talkin' back.
I heard that.
JESSE: Come on, Frank. FRANK: You play me that eight.
You ever-- Ever notice Zerelda's eyes?
Yeah! Yeah.
She got two of 'em, don't she?
I think one of them's glass. Yeah, which one is that?
translation.ko: - 한쪽이 유리 눈인 거 같아 - 어느 쪽이?

translation.en: Is that the right one or the left one?
The brown one. Hey!
Cole, don't make me tell the whole town
translation.ko: 콜, 네가 애틀랜타에서 연애하다 망한 거

translation.en: about that time you screwed that fella in Atlanta.
Ooh. You talkin' to me?
You mean that dance hall girl at Bunny's?
Yeah.
Sadie was a beautiful woman. Sadie was not a man.
She had a mustache. Nice mustache.
She had more than a mustache.
Well, she-she was European.
Ah, all right, I'll admit Sadie was a woman
if you just stop sayin' things about my Zee.
"My Zee"? Your Zee?
Yeah. Oh.
"From women's eyes, this doctrine I derive.
translation.ko: '여자들 눈을 보고 난 이런 교훈을 깨달았습니다'

translation.en: "They sparkle still, the right Promethean fire.
translation.ko: '여자의 눈은 여전히 반짝이고 프로메테우스의 불 같으며'

translation.en: "They are the books, the arts, the academes..
...that show, contain and nourish all the world."
Well, I don't know what it is you just said, but it sounded real nice.
That's Shakespeare.
Now, he's European.
Wanna write that down for me, Frank? So I can say it to Zee?
Yeah, I'll send you a telegram.
Thanks, brother.
Thanks for the help, Cole.
Well, you did plenty over at our place.
You miss it, don't you?
JESSE: The war? COLE: Yeah.
Hell, no.
There are things I miss about it, but...
translation.ko: 그리운 것도 몇 개 있긴 하지만...

translation.en: You know, it was exciting. Yeah.
But it was a whole lot of killing
and why should we miss that?
COLE: Well, 'cause we were good at it.
Shoot, we were great at it.
If you tell anybody I said this, I have to kill you 'cause everybody knows
translation.ko: 내가 이 말 한 거 딴 데 흘리면 죽는다, 왜냐면 다들 아니까

translation.en: that I'm the toughest man in this town.
translation.ko: 내가 이 마을에서 제일 강하다는 거

translation.en: But you are one terrifying son of a bitch with them guns.
translation.ko: 근데 넌 총만 들면 겁나 무서운 자식이 되잖아

translation.en: Yeah, well... [HORSES GALLOPING]
Boys.
Howdy, folks. How are you today?
Howdy. Yeah, easterners.
We're just fine, thank you, sir. I'm Rollin H. Parker.
translation.ko: - 안녕합니다, 고마워요 - 전 롤링 H. 파커입니다

translation.en: Personal emissary to Mr. Thaddeus Rains, president of the Rock Northern Railroad.
translation.ko: 록 노던 레일로드 새디어스 레인스 사장님의 개인 특사예요

translation.en: And this gentleman is the famous Allan Pinkerton.
Founder of the Secret Service
and currently under contract to Mr. Thaddeus Rains.
translation.ko: 현재는 새디어스 레인스 사장님의 사설 경비를 맡고 있죠

translation.en: As you no doubt heard from your neighbors
our railroad is moving West. That makes sense 'cause,
translation.ko: - 우리 회사는 서부로 확장 중이죠 - 그거 말 되네요

translation.en: see, East would put you underwater.
Moving West opened up the frontier to folks such as yourselves.
translation.ko: 서부 확장 덕분에 여러분에게도 기회가 생겼습니다

translation.en: It just so happens that your acreage here is located on the proposed right of way.
translation.ko: 여러분 농장이 철도 용지에 위치하고 있어서

translation.en: I am here... to get your signature
on this land sale contract.
And I'm authorized to pay you
$2 an acre.
Two dollars? PARKER: That's right.
That's the price approved by the Department
of the Interior of the Government of the United States of America.
This land ain't for sale.
Ma'am, I can understand how you feel.
You've made a lovely home here, but it really isn't up to me or you.
translation.ko: 멋진 터전을 떠나야 하니까요 근데 이건 어쩔 수 없어요

translation.en: You familiar with the legal concept
of right of eminent domain? Yeah, I am. What about it?
This land's about to be condemned.
So you see, I'm doing you folks a favor.
translation.ko: 그나마 제가 여러분께 호의를 베푸는 겁니다

translation.en: The price of $2 an acre is one-time-only deal.
After today, the price goes down.
So if I were you, I would just sign the contract
and we'll be on our way.
Good day, Mr. Parker.
You can tell Mr. Thaddeus Rains to put this
translation.ko: 레인스 사장에게 전하세요 이 계약서를 태양이 비치지 않는

translation.en: where the sun don't shine.
Shakespeare.
I don't think you understand.
You don't have a choice.
Ma'am, I think that you should search your heart here
and try to do the right thing.
Let me ask the Lord.
The Lord says we can bury 'em out back in the orchard.
Nobody'll ever find 'em.
translation.ko: 아무도 찾지 못하게 오늘은 주님이 복수의 화신이신가 봐요

translation.en: Somebody's in a vengeful mood today.
Why don't we let 'em go for today, Ma? We'll bury 'em out back next time.
translation.ko: 오늘은 그냥 보내주죠? 묻는 건 다음에 하고요

translation.en: MA: Oh, all right.
Now, ma'am-- [GUN COCKING]
You folks are making a serious mistake here.
Nicely played.
Tell all the folks what you told me, Frank.
translation.ko: 아까 나한테 한 얘기 다시 말해드려

translation.en: Well, I went to the courthouse to look
at the right-of-way documents for the rail bed.
The railroad doesn't even need our land.
They're just using our land on both sides for as far as the camp.
translation.ko: 우리 땅 양쪽을 최대한 차지하려는 거예요

translation.en: Uh, floor recognizes Clell Miller.
They're sayin' if we don't sell we might end up with nothing.
translation.ko: 그자들은 우리가 땅을 안 팔면 한 푼도 못 받을 거래요

translation.en: That's only if we don't stick together.
translation.ko: 우리가 단합하지 않으면 그렇게 될 거예요

translation.en: Loni Packwood.
I say this is the last straw.
I came back from the war.
My farm was burned down.
My cows was dead.
And now my wife's run off with my cousin Jeb.
That son of a bitch.
He took my dog!
DOC MIMMS: Uh, Loni, about the railroad.
He took my dog!
MAN: They got Cole!
ZEE: Daddy, he came to our house.
You'd all want to hear this.
They came up.
They made the same offer they made you folks.
Our little brother Jim tried to chase 'em off.
translation.ko: 내 동생 짐이 그놈들을 쫓아 보내려는데 경비 한 명이 동생 머리를 쳐서 넘어뜨렸어요

translation.en: One of the detectives hit him in the head and knocked him out.
translation.ko: 경비 한 명이 동생 머리를 쳐서 넘어뜨렸어요

translation.en: Cole lost his temper. Oh, no.
translation.ko: 그래서 콜이 폭발했죠 - 이런 - 콜이 약간 화를 분출했어요

translation.en: He just lost his temper a little.
How many of them did he kill, Bob?
Two. Cole.
They said that because the detectives was working
for the Department of the Interior-- The army can hang him.
Tomorrow. MAN: What do we do?
Nothin'.
You folks are gonna do nothin'. You're gonna go home right now.
translation.ko: 여러분은 아무것도 하지 말고 곧장 집으로 가세요

translation.en: You too, doc.
So you can swear on a Bible that you don't know anything
translation.ko: 성경을 걸고 맹세하세요 내일 어떤 일이 벌어질지

translation.en: about what's gonna happen tomorrow.
Boys-- Doc!
Go home.
They ain't gonna hang no more Liberty Boys.

Go home, everybody.
Go home.

Loni, Clell.

All right.
Eight of us against a Union regiment and Pinkerton detectives

He's smilin'.

The army has everything well in hand.

May God have mercy on his soul.
Brilliant.
Hang him! Pull it! Pull it!
MAN 1: Sir, are you all right?

The bullet came out clean but he's lost an awful lot of blood.

translation.en: He is gonna be fine, right, daddy?
Praying wouldn't hurt.
Who's that? Stay here with him.
Sir, we're looking for a fugitive. We're checking all the houses in the area.

translation.en: Powell, out back. McCall, check the first floor.
I'm goin' up. Sir, who are you?

Go!
Go.
Jesse, are you awake?
Jesse, is that your hand? Mm.

I fooled them into thinking I was alone.
Let's hope the boy pulls through.
I think he's feeling better already.

Well, I'm pleased to be here. Really?
No, Parker, no.

What's going on?
Well, sir..
Two weeks ago we managed to arrange

That's good. No, unfortunately not, sir.
Uh, a group of local thugs

translation.en: managed to rescue him from the gallows.
translation.ko: 여기 불한당 놈들이 그를 구출해 갔습니다 그래서 농부들에게 저항심을 고취했을 뿐 아니라

translation.en: Not only did this inspire resistance in the other farmers,

translation.en: but the redoubtable Mr. Allan Pinkerton was seriously injured in the incident.

translation.en: I see, sir.

Near, you know, here, but, ahem, out.

Oh, by the way, the Army's leaving town so Cole can stop hidin' up in the woods

Hey, you leave them alone. Leave 'em alone.
Cole. Clell.

How are you, Cole?

They sparkle...
still, like...

[SHOUTING] Come on.
Frank.

Ma!
Come on!

Ma!

take care.

Ma, Doc Mimms-- Shh!

Ma.

Our place.
Clell Miller's.
Sammy Johnston, The Creeders, Will Hite.

When I send them to their graves.
MAN 1: Thank you very much. MAN 2: Thank you.

translation.en: [GUNS COCKING] That safe?
Excuse me, sir.

Uh, it's a bank holiday and the bank's closed. There ain't no dadburned bank holiday!

The James Gang.

The James-Younger Gang!

translation.en: JIM: Ow! Stop! MAN: I'll show you "ow"!
Excuse me, sir? It's a bank holiday.

translation.ko: 무슨 얼어 죽을 쉬는 날! 뭔 소리 하는 거야?

translation.en: Mister! What the hell are you doing, mister?
JESSE: Sir, the safe.
Ma'am, do me a favor.
Turn around, cover your eyes. Why?
I'm gonna shoot this man. I don't think you want to see it.

translation.en: Thank you.
Hey. The safe.
Now!
It ain't no bank holiday! It's a bank holiday!
It ain't! You're right, sir.
Well, then why can't I go in there?
On account of that we're, uh, robbing it.
MAN: Oh, why didn't you just say so in the first place?
It's a secret. Oh!
Fine. Uh, I'll-- I'll just wait over here.
I'd appreciate that.
Go on! Get outta here.
What the...? What is it?

translation.en: How'd it go in there? Fine. How'd it go out here?
I think we should talk.

translation.en: Only one way ends with you still breathin'.

Where the hell were you?
I had you covered.
I got 5,000. I got three.
Eight thousand dollars! That's a thousand apiece!
Our luck is finally changing.
Now, what do we do with these? These are the property rights
translation.ko: 이건 어떡할까? 철도 회사가 은행에 맡긴

You better pass them over here before somethin' happens to 'em.
All right. Settle down.
Not all this money's ours.

See, that's why we had to go to all the trouble of stealing it.

translation.en: Look, we oughta take some of this money, give it to our neighbors in Liberty.

translation.ko: - 고통받는 사람들이 많잖아 - 그 사람들이 목숨 걸진 않았잖아

translation.en: See, Frank's being smart about this.

translation.en: Uh, yeah, it does. No, it don't, Bob.
Stay out of this. Look, I think Jesse's got a good idea.
Jim?
Who put you in charge of this gang, Jesse, huh?

translation.ko: 그래서 그 제안에 대한 네 의견을 다들 기다리잖아

translation.en: Cole, as the other leader of the gang.
That's fine. FRANK: What's that?
I said I reckon it's a smart thing to do.
Cole! Hey, that's it.
We decide somethin', that's it.
Now, we're in this for the long haul
and this plan of me and Jesse's...
smart, help us, give us places to hide.
translation.ko: 똑똑함으로 득을 보고 숨을 곳도 마련할 수 있어

translation.en: We don't have to worry about a farmer with a shotgun shootin' us in our sleep.
translation.ko: 자다가 농부한테 총 맞아 죽을까 걱정 안 해도 될 거라고

translation.en: We got to think. What's that word, Frank?
translation.ko: 생각을 해야지 그걸 뭐라고 하지, 프랭크?

translation.en: "Strategically."
Yeah. Thank you. Strategically.
'Cause this is a war. This ain't no war.
What's that?
Nobody paid me no thousand dollars to fight in a war.
translation.ko: 전쟁에서 싸웠다고 나 돈 받은 적 없어

translation.en: MAN: Me, neither.
One down. Damn it, Tom.
You cheatin' again?
I'm broke again. Next up, Thaxton Switch.
translation.ko: - 나 또 망했어 - 다음, 색스턴 스위치

translation.en: Yeah, see, that ain't a bank, Jesse.
It is better. I mean, it's a construction depot,
so it'll have the strongbox, some ammo, explosives.
We can take those. That way we can do a bigger job next time.
translation.ko: 그거 훔치면 다음엔 더 큰 일을 할 수 있어

translation.en: And it's guarded by Pinkerton detectives.
And I do so want to kill me some Pinkerton detectives.
Boys!
We're famous. What's this?
"The Fidelity Bank was robbed on Tuesday by a gang of 20 heavily armed men."
Twenty? What are the odds?
Another gang robbin' the same bank on the same day as us.
translation.ko: 다른 갱단도 그날 우리처럼 똑같은 은행을 턴 거잖아

translation.en: "The outlaws calling themselves the James-Younger Gang
translation.ko: '그 무법자들은 자신들을 제임스 영거 갱이라고 밝혔다'

translation.en: "shot their way out of town, wounding the sheriff
"and three other townsfolk.
The bank officials estimate the loss of $50,000."
Fifty thousand dollars? More like 50,000 pesos.
translation.ko: 5만 달러? 5만 페소에 가깝지 '세인트루이스에 소재한 미 사법 지구는 이 사건을'

translation.en: "The U.S. District Marshal at St. Louis called this
translation.ko: '세인트루이스에 소재한 미 사법 지구는 이 사건을'

translation.en: the first daylight bank robbery in American history."
translation.ko: '미국 역사상 최초의 대낮 강도 사건이라고 했다'

translation.en: Here's to history. I'll drink to that.
We made history? That is something to be proud of.
The rest of that's a bunch of horseshit.
Next time we're gonna have to set the record straight ourselves.
Line 'em up!
Barkeep! Whiskey!
They exchanged fire with the Pinkerton guards,
wounding several.
Then they raided the payroll office and blew the track.
How much did they get from the safe?
Thirty five thousand, sir, in coins and currency.
Not to mention the added delay of miles of destroyed track.
I'll kill 'em for blowing up my railway.
PARKER: To be precise, sir, they didn't actually blow the track.
translation.ko: 정확히 말씀드리면 철로를 폭파한 건 그놈들이 아닙니다

translation.en: Then who did? Whoa.
We did.
I mean, our men... did.
Our workers planted the dynamite,
but they were under duress.
Pinkerton, what is going on here?
translation.ko: 핑커톤 대체 어떻게 돼 가는 건가?

translation.en: My professional opinion
is that you've managed to piss off the wrong bunch of farm boys this time.
translation.ko: 이번에 사장님이 농장 놈들을 잘못 건드리신 거 같습니다

translation.en: Well, they had to be dealt with.
By burning down their homes? You wouldn't have done that?
Oh, I'd have done that, all right,
but I'd have made sure I killed 'em all first.
I want them arrested and hanged.
Do you think a jury in these parts would convict one of their own?
translation.ko: 이곳 배심원이 그놈들에게 유죄를 내릴 것 같습니까?

translation.en: Uh-uh. I doubt it. We're beginning a very interesting game here, Mr. Rains.
translation.ko: 설마요, 우린 지금 재밌는 게임을 시작한 겁니다

translation.en: This is no game.
Well, I'm afraid our adversaries
don't agree.
"Rock Island Pacific Railroad Depot was robbed
"just outside of St. Louis, Missouri.
"The brave and daring James-Younger Gang
"was heavily outnumbered by Pinkerton detectives,
but the city lawmen were no match for the guns of the West."
translation.ko: 도시 출신 핑커톤 경비대는 서부 총잡이들에게 상대가 안 됐다'

translation.en: Fine piece of writin'.
"The gang destroyed the Thaxton Switch construction,
"meaning that, for a few months, honest farmers will be able
"to sleep without fearing the railroad
is coming to steal their land." Now, who wrote this?
translation.ko: '걱정하지 않고 푹 잘 수 있을 것이다'

translation.en: I'll see 'em hanged every Tuesday for a month.
translation.ko: 한 달간 화요일마다 이걸 쓴 놈들을 교수형에 처하게

translation.en: Oh, that's the best part.
"Foregoing article was sent to this newspaper
was reputedly written by the outlaw Jesse James himself."
translation.ko: '무법자 제시 제임스가 직접 쓴 글이라고 합니다'

translation.en: Hey, look at that! What is it?
"Better...
"slow down.
"Dynamite "ahead.
"Too late.
You're dead!"
Whoo! Yes, sir!
That was a fine piece of driving.
Damn!
BANK TELLER: Thank you, Mr. Williams. Four more payments
translation.ko: 네, 윌리엄스 씨 4번만 더 내시면 부동산담보대출 밀린 금액이 해결될 겁니다

translation.en: and you'll be caught up on the mortgage.
Look carefully at these Yankee two-dollar bills.
I've gotten funny ones lately. Good day to you, sir.
translation.ko: 요즘 이상한 지폐를 봤거든요 이만 끊겠습니다

translation.en: Good afternoon, sir. Could you change this for me?
Certainly, sir. Thank you.
[CHUCKLING] Sir, I'm sorry, but this bill is counterfeit.
I don't think so. [TELLER WHIMPERING]
I'm gonna have to see the rest of your money so I can compare.
translation.ko: 댁의 남은 돈 좀 봅시다 비교 좀 하게

translation.en: It's a scientific method. I hear it's all the rage. Uh-huh.
Yes, you-- You can compare all of them, Mr.--
James. Jesse James?
Yes, sir. It's a terrible sketch.
translation.ko: 네, 그림이 형편없네요 "제시, 프랭크 제임스를 체포할 경우 5,000달러 포상"

translation.en: That's-- That's all I have, sir.
Well, thank you. It's been a pleasure.
Yes, sir. Take care now, you hear?
Goodbye, sir. Have a good day. Goodbye.
Pinkerton, why can't you catch these outlaws?
translation.ko: 핑커톤, 이놈들을 못 잡는 이유가 뭔가?

translation.en: It's early in the game yet, sir.
Jesse James and I are just learning each other's moves,
translation.ko: 제시 제임스와 저는 이제서야 서로의 수를 읽고 있어요

translation.en: feeling out each other's patterns.
Oh, well, I'm losing millions of dollars and months of time
translation.ko: 그럼 난 수백만 달러와 수많은 시간을 잃고 있는 거군

translation.en: while you play chess with these farmers.
translation.ko: 자네가 이 농부들과 체스를 두는 동안

translation.en: Hardly farmers, sir.
Each one of these men
has four years of bloody fightin' experience behind 'em.
They are disciplined and have a charismatic leader.
translation.ko: 훈련도 잘돼 있고 카리스마가 있는 리더도 있어요

translation.en: If I were to design the perfect outlaw band,
translation.ko: 제가 만일 완벽한 무법자 갱단을 만든다면

translation.en: this is the gang I'd create.
So what can you tell me?
translation.ko: 그래서 어떤 말을 하고 싶은 건가?

translation.en: It's going to be a long winter.
Hyah! Hyah! Let's go!
Take this road. Come on!
Come on, boys! Come on!
Phew! Never thought that posse was gonna give up.
Yeah, they were admirably persistent.
That's the longest chase we've had.
translation.ko: 우리가 겪었던 것 중 가장 긴 추격전이었어

translation.en: Jesse, we gotta have a word. Sure, cousin.
translation.ko: - 제시, 얘기 좀 하자 - 그래, 사촌

translation.en: All the newspapers are calling this bunch the James-Younger Gang.
Right? Yeah.
translation.ko: - 그치? - 응 근데 왜 이름이 영거-제임스 갱이 아니야?

translation.en: Why the hell aren't we the Younger-James gang?
translation.ko: 근데 왜 이름이 영거-제임스 갱이 아니야?

translation.en: I mean, we got three Younger brothers and two James brothers.
Well, I kinda like the sound of the James-Younger gang.
Hey, Jim, I'll beat the piss out of you right now.
Now, stay out of this. BOB: Jimmy's got a point, Cole.
translation.ko: - 끼지 마 - 지미 말이 맞아, 콜

translation.en: The "Younger-James Gang" is confusing.
How's that, Bob? Well...
say we burst into a bank
and we yell, "we're the Younger-James Gang!"
People are gonna be thinkin', the Younger-James Gang...
translation.ko: 다들 이럴 거 아냐 '영거 제임스 갱...'

translation.en: Is there an Older James Gang? COLE: Hey.
BOB: How come we never heard of the Older James gang?
translation.ko: '올더 제임스 갱 얘기는 왜 못 들어봤지?'

translation.en: So people tryin' to figure that out instead of raisin' their arms.
translation.ko: 그래서 그거 생각하느라 손도 안 들 거 아냐

translation.en: Can't argue with that, Cole.
Do we even have the same mama? Huh? Do we?
translation.ko: 우리 같은 배에서 태어난 형제 맞아?

translation.en: Is anybody hearin' me? Huh? See, I got a little idea.
translation.ko: 내 말 좀 들어줄래? 나한테 좋은 생각이 있어

translation.en: If I kill you, then I kill Jim, I'm gonna have no arguments.
translation.ko: 내가 너랑 짐을 죽이면 더는 반박 못 하겠지

translation.en: Pinkerton? It's been eight months.
I see holdups and I see robberies.
translation.ko: 총기 강도도 겪었고 은행 강도도 겪었어

translation.en: I don't see men on the end of nooses.
Most of these James Gang's encounters, sir,
translation.ko: 제임스 갱과 교전을 벌일 때 이들은 대부분

translation.en: have been with local law enforcement.
translation.ko: 현지 법 집행 기관과 함께 있었습니다

translation.en: Quite frankly are no match for this gang's cunning.
translation.ko: 솔직히 이들의 교활함을 이길 수가 없어요

translation.en: What about your detectives? Listen, you!
Shut up.
Now...
I have to hunt this man.
I have to get inside this man's mind.
I have to anticipate him.
And that takes time. Time, time, time.
I can't believe this.
Would you believe there are certain towns in Missouri
translation.ko: 미주리주 어떤 마을들에선 제임스 갱이 영웅처럼

translation.en: where the James Gang walks openly in the street as heroes.
PARKER: Now, how can that be?
PINKERTON: Because they are charitable.
They give money to churches, to farmers.
they gave the sharecroppers of Maddox so much money
they even built a school.
That's my money. Well, sir,
we should burn that school to the ground.
That's the way to win' em back to our side.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 농부들 맘을 잘도 얻겠소

translation.en: RAINS: Pinkerton, hundreds of men have lost their lives
translation.ko: 핑커톤, 철로를 건설하느라 수백 명의 인부가 죽었지만

translation.en: to build this railroad but they did their jobs.
Now, this-- This Jesse James, that's your job. Do your job.
translation.ko: 이제 제시 제임스는 자네 일이니 알아서 처리해

translation.en: Then you let me do my job
as I see fit without interference.
translation.ko: 적당한 때를 기다릴 테니 방해 마시라고요

translation.en: What can you tell me?
It's going to be a long spring.
If people would just hand over their money and not shoot at us,
translation.ko: 사람들이 우리에게 돈을 그냥 주고 총을 안 쏘면

translation.en: there'd be a lot less killing.
What's that? It's my lucky rabbit's foot.
Took it off that dead fellow over there. I don't think that one's working, Loni.
translation.ko: - 죽은 놈한테서 가져왔지 - 효과 없을 거야, 로니

translation.en: What?
Jesse James! Can I have your autograph?
Take us to the West.
Lane, Grogan, you take this. You take these towns.
translation.ko: 레인, 그로건, 자네들은 이쪽 자네는 이 마을들로 가

translation.en: You remind me of--
Here, write this. I'm not writing this.
Ahem. Your blue-green eyes remind me of--
That land in the sky. The land in the sky.
translation.ko: - 하늘의 그 땅 - 하늘의 그 땅

translation.en: That "even here."
You might want to change that to, uh, "I thought of you."
Ah, look, just write the whole thing yourself. I...
Okay, sir, I think we know how this is gonna go.
translation.ko: 선생님, 어떻게 해야 할지 아실 겁니다

translation.en: One false move and I'll blow your head off!
[MAN GASPING] Bob? You heard me, Jesse!
You know how crazy I get! Crazy!
Bob.
We got a problem, little brother?
Frankly, yeah. I'm feelin' a little...left out.
translation.ko: 솔직히 그래 나 좀... 소외되는 거 같아

translation.en: This is about the wanted posters, isn't it?
Yeah, obviously someone's not standin' out in people's minds at the robberies.
translation.ko: 강도질할 때 사람들한테 난 별 볼 일 없어 보이잖아

translation.en: Gents, we're in the middle of somethin' here.
Yeah, Bob's upset. The posters?
Yeah.
Don't say "yeah" in that tone of voice!
This is important! Okay.
Pardon the delay, folks, but we had to get "Mad" Bob Younger under control.
translation.ko: 지체돼서 죄송하지만 지금 '삐친' 밥 영거 좀 먼저 해결할게요

translation.en: Yeah. Bob here'll kill a man for sneezin'.
translation.ko: 네, 여기 밥은 재채기만으로도 사람을 죽이는 애예요

translation.en: And he's the best shot in the gang.
translation.ko: - 우리 갱단에서 가장 뛰어나죠 - 당신보다도요, 제시?

translation.en: Better than you, Jesse? JESSE: Bob Younger...
translation.ko: - 우리 갱단에서 가장 뛰어나죠 - 당신보다도요, 제시? 밥 영거가...

translation.en: taught me how to shoot.
translation.ko: 제게 총 쏘는 법을 가르쳐 줬어요

translation.en: FRANK: Now...
how about we get back to the robbery?
Of course. That means now, mister!
Now.
That's it. No more bets. LONI: One more time.
Come on. Talk to me. Oh!
Talk to me one more time. Pretty please.
translation.ko: 한 번만 더 얘기해, 제발 부탁이야

translation.en: Yeah! Damn, Loni, you're lucky.
Luckiest man in the West. Now that I'm ridin' with Jesse James.
translation.ko: 서부에서 최고의 행운아 이제는 제시 제임스와 함께하지

translation.en: You okay, Jesse? Drinkin' whiskey, Jim?
translation.ko: - 괜찮아, 형? - 위스키를 마시는 거야, 짐?

translation.en: You're too young to be drinkin' whiskey.
Not too young to shoot a man, not too young to drink whiskey.
translation.ko: 총 쏘기에도, 위스키 마시기에도 어리지 않아

translation.en: Jim, you, uh, been with a girl yet?
translation.ko: 짐, 너 여자랑 같이 있어 봤어?

translation.en: Tonight? I was gettin' ready to turn on that Younger charm.
translation.ko: 아마도 오늘 밤? 영거 가문의 매력을 발산할까 했지

translation.en: Well, not exactly. You been with a girl ever?
translation.ko: - 그건 사실 아니고 - 한 번도 없었어?

translation.en: Hell, yeah, I've been with a girl!
Look, I just-- I didn't want to get one of them paid ladies.
You know what I mean? I think so.
Ahem. I mean, you, Frank, Cole, even Bob,
translation.ko: 형, 프랭크 형, 콜 형, 밥 형까지

translation.en: you get all the girls 'cause you're good-lookin' and famous.
They just look at me like I'm your baby brother.
Don't tell nobody.
I swear. Not a word.
You okay?
Tell you what...uh!
I can't drink good neither.
I'm gonna go outside and throw up. Uh! You do that. Hurry.
Hmm! Hey, Loni.
Oh, yeah! Mm!
Let's go, sugar britches.
Just call me "Lucky" Loni Packwood.
PARKER: The new route for the railroad is complete, sir.
Parker? Yes, sir?
What's that? That, sir?
Jenkins will explain that.
Sir! Jenkins.
Yes, well, uh, we have done a financial study
of the construction costs projecting--
Jenkins!
It's...cheaper to go around Jesse James, sir.
translation.ko: 제시 제임스 지역을 우회하는 게 비용을 절약할 수 있습니다

translation.en: Even with the detours and the extra track,
it's-it's just...cheaper.
So you are telling me...
that Jesse James has won?
Oh, no. No, no, no.
You see, every three months the James Gang circles back
to the vicinity of Liberty, Missouri,
and they always pull a job before they return.
So?
So there's only four banks
within that travel radius they've not robbed.
Could you put men at all four?
I don't have to.
I've a much better tool at my disposal for narrowing it down to one bank.
translation.ko: 한 은행으로 줄일 수 있는 더 좋은 방법이 있습니다

translation.en: What's that? An intense hatred
of you.
Jesse.
Things a fella's gotta do to get a little respect around here.
translation.ko: 이제 이 몸이 존경심을 받는 거 같아

translation.en: Finally. You deserve it, Bob. It's about time.
translation.ko: 드디어, 당연히 그래야지, 밥 때가 된 거야

translation.en: Thank you.
Listen, Jesse, um... we got a problem.
It's Cole.
Ah, he's been full of vinegar lately.
He's plannin' a job. He's what?
Look, he's my brother... and I don't wanna start trouble.
translation.ko: 콜은 내 형제잖아 난 문제 일으키기 싫어

translation.en: Tell me.
Cole, are you sure? Tell you what, boys.
This is gonna be the biggest score yet. What will be?
translation.ko: - 이번 일이 최대 규모가 될 거야 - 뭐가?

translation.en: Hyperion Bank. Two days' ride from Liberty.
Got $100,000 in railroad money just sittin' there.
translation.ko: 철도 회사 자금 십만 달러가 거기 있어

translation.en: That's in the paper, huh? Don't sound right.
translation.ko: 신문에 난 거지? 근데 어째 좀 이상해

translation.en: If you read about it first, you'd have no problems.
translation.ko: 네가 먼저 읽었으면 토 달지 않았을 텐데 무슨 소리야, 콜?

translation.en: What are you saying, Cole?
Jesse, I've robbed just as many banks as you have, all right?
I know this town, I know this bank and I say it's an easy job.
translation.ko: 이 마을, 은행도 꿰뚫고 있어 이거 식은 죽 먹기야

translation.en: I think you're forgettin' who's in charge.
translation.ko: 여기 리더가 누군지 잊었나 봐 제시

translation.en: Jesse.
You're in charge? Huh?
We ain't partners no more, Jesse? Let me get this straight.
translation.ko: 우리 이젠 동업자도 아니야? 분명히 짚고 넘어가자

translation.en: You tell Cole Younger when and where to ride?
translation.ko: 네가 뭔데 콜 영거한테 이래라저래라하는 거야?

translation.en: Cole, he didn't mean that. You're takin' sides against me now?
translation.ko: - 제시는 그런 뜻이 아니야 - 지금 내 편 안 드는 거야?

translation.en: No.
COLE: So bein' with me is bein' against you?
translation.ko: 내 편을 드는 게 너와 등지는 거냐?

translation.en: We don't wanna do that. No.
None of us poor idiots wanna go up against Jesse James.
translation.ko: 바보 같은 우리는 제시 제임스한테 반대하면 안 되지

translation.en: Greatest outlaw who ever lived.
That's what it says in the paper.
Weren't for you, this gang wouldn't be able
translation.ko: 너 아니면 우린 똥꼬에 막대기 박힌

translation.en: to find a goat's ass with a stick.
translation.ko: 염소 한 마리도 못 찾을 거래

translation.en: You have gotten mighty full of yourself lately, Jesse.
You think so?
You all do?
Frank?
The one time one of us comes up with an idea--
translation.ko: 우리 중 한 명이 처음으로 계획을...

translation.en: A bad idea. Hey.
